stance_1: I eat meat with most meals
stance_2: I prefer chicken for cost reasons
justification: Eating meat with most meals is supported by choosing a meat (chicken) that is cost-effective, making frequent consumption more sustainable.

stance_1: I eat meat with most meals
stance_2: I prefer chicken for health reasons
justification: Eating meat frequently is supported by the belief that chicken is the healthiest meat, justifying regular consumption.

stance_1: I eat meat with most meals
justification: Family avoidance of pork shapes the types of meat regularly eaten, contributing to eating other meats with most meals.

stance_1: I prefer chicken for health reasons
stance_2: I prefer chicken for cost reasons
justification: The preference for chicken is strongly supported by both cost and health motivations, as both are cited as reasons for this choice.

stance_2: My family is concerned about high blood pressure
justification: Family avoidance of pork is explicitly justified by concern about high blood pressure.
